Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: Joseph Yonke II
Reviews.Content: I decided to upgrade the TV in my kitchen. Had been using a 13" CRT but wanted a flat screen like the rest of the TVS in the house. Actually didn't buy this from Amazon. Bought it locally because the price was the same and I could have it NOW! Another plus was that if I decided that I really didn't like the TV or its sound I could easily and quickly return it. The only downside was state taxes. First off I should say I have no problem with the sound portion of this TV. A few other have commented on that but it plays and sounds just fine. I have a 7.1 surround sound hooked to my main television so I have a reference. No, I'm not even trying to compare the two but I am aware of sound quality. This is quite a bargain and the overall quality is more than satisfactory. I was a good choice for me and therefore I can recommend it.Update: after listening to the sound produced by this TV for maybe a month or so, I decided to add a set of small speakers to it which has improved the sound quality dramatically. Though it was possible to listen to it originally, adding the speakers completely removed any sound issue.

Reviews.Title: Flimsy Bezel
Reviews.Author: jrvtecaccord
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV to replace a Samsung T260HD that has been great as a "hybrid" monitor.  This TV was going to be used for 50/50 computer monitor & PS3 gaming for a child's room.  Unfortunately it's come time to replace the T260HD due to a loose rear HDMI connector and just looking outdated compared to new models.  There are not to many QUALITY choices on 1080P tv's 26" or smaller so I gave this 22" a shot.  First the TV aesthetics look great!  Connections are good with side facing HDMI, but didn't like the rear headphone jack since it's frequently used.  Another plus was NO "power brick", usually small TV's this thin have an external power converter.  PQ was good for a screen this size, and surprising sound was decent too.Unfortunately I had to return this tv because of the flimsy bezel that is around the screen.  I had the tv wall mounted using an articulating mount.  During gentle adjustments holding the top and bottom of the screen to adjust tilt, the top portion of the bezel would snap off.  Being in a child's room with daily adjustments, there is no way it would physically last.  Looking at the bezel, it looks like it just uses snaps on the top and screws on the bottom.So if you plan to use this tv on an articulating mount, I can't recommend, but if you don't it should make a great little tv.

Reviews.Title: Lacks features and has other problems/defects
Reviews.Author: Ash Bzak "Ash"
Reviews.Content: I was pretty pleased with this TV when I removed it from the box.  It was slim/light and had a slick look.  The picture was respectable for a 22" and the sound was okay.  I was also happy that a model this size offered 2 HDMI ports.  Also, it looks great as a monitor for my computer.  But... then I noticed a few problems.Minor Problems:-No soft mute-Very hard to manually add/remove channels.  (Originally, after messing with my TV and its manual, I concluded that it wasn't possible... but it is if you hit the "content" button on the remote.)  This may not seem like a huge deal, but the TV ended up picking up 100+ channels.  Most of those are the HD versions of my channels.  I'd like to remove the repeats and just keep the HD versions, but the TV really hides this feature.  I found out where to do it, but I still can't get it right. It is a shame.Major Problems:-The A/V, component adapter that connects to the TV just doesn't work.  This is the second time I've had Amazon ship me this TV and the adapter still doesn't work.  I've tested it with three different devices and the TV doesn't recognize any of them.  A huge problem for me, considering not all of my devices can connect using HDMI (so I must use the component).  I'm sending this model back and trying a different one.  I want a TV with working ports.-Samsung's customer service is not so good.  They told me that I should buy a new adapter because the one they sent me could be defective.  What?  No thanks, Samsung.  Thank goodness for Amazon's fantastic return policy.In summary, check ALL the inputs before your 30-day grace period ends with Amazon.  The VGA, 2 HDMIs, component, headphone jack, USB, etc should all work out of the box.  If they don't, send it back!  Samsung isn't the best with customer service, so I suggest dealing with Amazon first and foremost.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed with the sound
Reviews.Author: Carmen J. Masciantonio
Reviews.Content: I've only had this TV for three days and the poor sound quality is driving me crazy!  No matter what setting it's on (movie, music, clear voice, etc) it sounds horrible (like a harsh AM radio)!  There is no bass whatsoever, the background noise is more pronounced than the dialog (even when the setting that enhances the dialog is on), and every "s" sounds scratchy, even when you turn the high frequencies all the way down with the useless equalizer.  The TV has many innovative features like ConnectShare and an impressive HD picture, but the sound ruins everything.  Samsung could have done better.

Reviews.Title: Quality reserved
Reviews.Author: Kerry Davis "Kerry"
Reviews.Content: I have two Samsung tvs. - 22inch and 32inch - They are quality.  The picture is great.  The style is great.They definitely have to enhance the sound quality.  I have to turn the tvs to a really high volume number tohear them at a normal range.  I bought speakers for the 32 inch tv - but I can't use the control for changingchannels or for mute when I have the speakers on.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Daniel Jenkins "danielwjenkins"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this after returning a Samsung monitor that had terrible LED bleeding problems. This set has no flaws and is generous with its specs considering the price. The unit is very sturdy  on its base and would make a great monitor or small bedroom tv.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my Motorhome
Reviews.Author: Babysteps
Reviews.Content: I mounted this TV in my motorhome using a cantilever mount and I love it. Thepicture and sound are great. The sound is even better using the headphone outjack and external speakers. The AV, component, and HDMI connections all workperfectly. The remote control is one of easiest to use I have ever seen. It has an HDMI button for immediate access to that input. The USB input is nice. Store all your movies on a thumb drive and you don't even need a DVD player.As previously noted, the top of the bezel may come loose,but this shouldn'tbe a deal breaker. If it continues to be a problem, I intend to secure mine with a bit of super glue.

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV for small spaces
Reviews.Author: J. Polo "EllenandJay"
Reviews.Content: I love it.  Remodeled our kitchen and wanted a small TV to mount on a wall that would not become a focal point.  It's a great HDTV.  Super slim design barely protrudes from the wall.  Very light weight.  Excellent picture.  It's great that they can cram 1080 pixels into only 22".  And the overall TV design is very simple and clean.  Well made.I installed a power outlet behind it and ran the HDMI cable through the wall.  The TV is so slim that it has very little space remaining to route the cables behind it.  It has a channel molded into the back.  Part of the problem was I did not use a standard wall mount kit - the TV is less than 2" thick, and I did not want to double that by using a standard wall mount bracket.  Turned out great.

Reviews.Title: Sound Fix
Reviews.Author: R. A. Miu
Reviews.Content: There are many complaints about the sound on this TV. Here is a solution. On Amazon, search for "Speakers 2.1". These are the 2 channel stereo speakers used on a PC with a standard sound card. These speakers come with an audio jack that will plug into the TV's headphone jack. Once plugged in the TV speakers will be off and the sound will come through the external 2.1 speaker set.I would recommend that you purchase a powered set of speakers (they have an amplifier integrated with the speakers) and a set with a sub-woofer to improve the bass response. Of course the better the set of speakers, the better the sound will be.I am using an old set of PC speakers from one of my older computers -- this is much better than the speakers that come with the TVIn general I love the TV -- the picture is great.  The sound is not so good, but that is because there really is no room in the TV for a good set of speakers.

Reviews.Title: Tin Can Alley Sound
Reviews.Author: Carib-Islander
Reviews.Content: It hooked up easy and is very lightweight. The articulating arm that was reccomended fit perfect and in a matter of minutes I had it hung on the wall and working.Now for the bad part... the sound quality sucks .... my ipad has better sound than this...I expected a little more.It phases in and out on the sound so not sure what is going on there. Was going to buy a Vizio but decided not to because of their sound ratings. This one is just as bad.I guess for what I purchased it for it will do. But Samsung needs to address the quality of the sound.

Reviews.Title: A  little problem
Reviews.Author: wbr
Reviews.Content: It is a great looking  item.  Picture quality is fine. However,  there is  a fading of the picture in the lower left hand corner of the screen that detracts from  the quality that I am working with Samsung to get rid of.  Sound quality is acceptable but not superior.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN22D5000 22-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED HDTV (Black)
Reviews.Author: Cisko7
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a nice small tv for a bedroom, i saw a phillips Philips 22PFL4505D/F7 22-Inch 720p LED LCD HDTV, Black.. I ended choosing the Samsung one.Slim and Stylish LED HDTVenergy-efficient Led tecnogid allows for a slimmer television design,  its only a inch deep (of curse, without its stand. This tv it's very elegant a sofisticated, brigs classy -and yet modern- look of any room.1080p Full HD With Two HDMI InputsIts very rare to find a Full HD 1080p resolution in a small panel, every person its gonna say thats its no neccesary for a model of that inch (and its true) BUT the collors are very vivd and detailed.. STUNNING. The 2HDMI ports also are very usefull, most of the 22" models have only one.ConnectShare MovieThis is awensome, only connect a pendrive, External HDD, Ipod or any device with media and you are ready to go, you can watch yor movies, clips, or lisen your music through the TV, amazing almost every format and even digital camera via USB and enjoy your picturesWide Color Enhancer Plusgive you entire spectrum of color and luminance for rich, saturated images with intense detail., compare this tv at your local store against other with the same range size/price.. you are gonna to be amazed for sure with the samsungAudio PerformanceI see a lot of complains of this departament, you had to understand.. its only one inch deep, so a two 3-watt speakers do what they souposed to do.. brings excellent sound in small-mediums rooms (also nobody puts this kind of tv in the living room), SRS' TheaterSound and additional technologies like Dolby Digital Plus and support for multi-channel sound (MTS)Anynet+ (Anynet Plus)I never tested, so can't say anithing on this.PC ConnectivityHad a 15pins port (wich a not use) but I hook my laptop through the HDMI por.. AWENSOME.. web browsing look superb!I see a lot of isssues with ports, i have to say mine does not give me problem at all, but i wish the AV imput were like the rest of the tv's and not through a adapter.. . I thought it was only this mmodel, but i seen 32" tv samsung led tv with te same desing... .I only can speack for myself, this is a terrific tv, great quality, elegant desing, FULL HD, a lots of functions and a pretty sweet price.GREAT

Reviews.Title: Good Picture/Weak Speakers
Reviews.Author: Adam Stein-Sapir
Reviews.Content: Just purchased this product to replace a Vizio 22" 720p which had horribly slow response times when using Time Warner's guide.  The response time problem seems to be resolved (due to better electronics in the Samsung I assume) and the picture quality is quite good. However, where one problem is solved another is created: the speakers are unbelievably weak.  With both cable and TV at max volume it is not audible with any significant background noise and you have to strain to hear it 8' away.  I will probably need to order separate speakers now.

Reviews.Title: Very good product - Really liked it.
Reviews.Author: Priyabrata
Reviews.Content: This one is very nice for small sized rooms. I really liked the looks and quality of the product. Sound quality is not bad. Picture quality is quite good. Only problem i faced was the defective RCA cable that i received. I read from some of the reviews that the their RCA port also not working after changing the TV for twice. First i thought it to be a problem with my TV. But i checked it in some other tvs and found it defective. So bought a new one. May be samsung is selling defective cables to all of their new customers to make some more business :):)Big thanks to Amazon for the two days delivery & return policy. 5 out of 5 for Amazon. I am very happy with all my orders placed in amazon. Big fan of Amazon..Cheers !!

Reviews.Title: Pretty Nice LED TV, Love it!!
Reviews.Author: Jinliang Liao
Reviews.Content: This TV is pretty much I want~~I use it as TV, gaming screen computer moniter and even a media player. All of the ports work and they are all work great!The TV incredible slim, and it shows nice picture quality, because it is LED and Full-HDAbout the USB port, which is so surprise me! It even support plug in HDD hard drive! not only a thumb drive!!It means u can use your 1TB drive and watch hundreds of movies on it!!Before buying the TV, I browse om the official web site and download the manuals to check specifications, it says only 5500 series  above can access HDD hard drive. But I plugged in my 40GB and 1TB hard drive, they all works!!!And for the media players, it support most of video format, which include MKV, AVI, MP4, RMVB,etc. And up to 1080P, without any lagging issue.The sound of the TV, I saw many previous reviews mention that sound is tiny  and low quality. But my TV has no problem, it is loud enough for me. and very clear.But the only thing should be notice, the special component port and  VGA port should plug entirely, u may push a little bit make the port perfectly connect, otherwise u may not work.over all, very satisfy with this product, give it a 5 star!!

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: WBN
Reviews.Content: We wanted a new TV for our cottage.  Worked flawlessly right out of the box.  We are not using it with a computer or a sound  system, nothing fancy. If you a looking for a good basic TV this is it. We did connect it to our DVD player no problem there eather. Great Value.

Reviews.Title: Great small TV
Reviews.Author: John J. Hildebrand
Reviews.Content: I am now a Samsung fan.  This little TV has a great picture and great Features.  It shipped super fast and came in an easy to handle box.  Now I need to get the big screen version.

Reviews.Title: Good Monitor / TV
Reviews.Author: Beth C
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv on sale for a family member to use as a monitor and television.  The picture is nice, the price was right and the design looks sleek.  We were not overly concerned with the sound since if we want to watch movies / have the theater experience we would never rely on a television set's speakers.Some people had mentioned that the composite / component adapter didn't seem to work.  I at first thought I had this same problem, but after calling samsung realized that you have to REALLY push the adapter end into the tv.  Worked fine after that.Have bought samsung in the past, and have never had issues with warranties being honored, etc.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV, sound is legible
Reviews.Author: DSharp "Maine-iac"
Reviews.Content: I thought I'd post a review because I'm using this TV primarily for standard def cable shows (no converter box). We also have a blu-ray connected as well. So far, we're pleasantly surprised.We were worried after reading the negative reviews of this TV but there aren't a lot of options as Samsung and LG are the only "big name" brands that I've found to make a 22-inch LED TV. So we decided to take the plunge based on our past good experiences with Samsung products.We're using this as a second TV in a medium-sized bedroom, and mostly for regular/standard definition cable. The picture quality on standard def was a pleasant surprise. It's quite good. (We previously returned a 22-inch Vizio that was fine for high def but horrible on standard def). The sound? Well, it's not great. But there's plenty of volume and voices are legible. It's OK for most TV shows, news etc. I can't compare to other TVs this size but doubt any of them have truly good sound. High-def content is fine as you'd expect with a Samsung.The similar Samsung 5003-series 22-inch TV gets decent reviews but lacks any audio outputs. This TV has a mini jack and optical output so there are options for improving sound for those who'll be using it for more than everyday TV shows. I'm running the optical output into a mini Marantz system, which sounds great. But the TV's internal speakers are acceptable for everyday use.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 22inch HD TV
Reviews.Author: Joseph F. Vercellotti
Reviews.Content: The Samsung tV fit the space limitations of an under-the-cabinet kitchen location.  Its rotating base permits its watching from different locations in the kitchen (useful while preparing or eating meals in the kitchen) The picture quality is superb for watching from relatively short distances.  The only limitation from giving it 5 stars is its relatively low-fi sound quality, but which is adequate for kitchen service.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV but poor sound
Reviews.Author: T. Speed
Reviews.Content: Read all the Amazon reviews before purchasing this TV.  I use it in my bedroom to have a little something to watch before bedtime.  It's a nice picture and size but the reviews were right, the sound quality is poor.  Other than that, all is good and it arrived on time, with all the parts and it was easy to put together.

Reviews.Title: Good package with a hint of you-get-what-you-pay-for
Reviews.Author: jhammin
Reviews.Content: I have this hooked up to a PC via HDMI running at 1920x1080, and for the price, I did not find any comparably equipped LED displays.  The UN22D5000 has excellent color range; decent speakers considering the footprint, weight, and cost; and looks stylish as well.After using this as a PC monitor for about a week, I have noticed some glaring faults.  First, picture sharpness struggles to hold up to other only slightly more expensive LED displays and cheaper PC monitors.  Some of this can be mitigated by spending some time with the excellent display tweaking control panel, but I generally have no problem with that kind of thing and was still unable to achieve the sharpness I wanted (after tweaking, small text remains somewhat distorted, but everything else displays well for the most part).  Second, the mini-stereo output suffers from noticeable background fuzz.  Finally, the base is flimsy.  While I'm experiencing a closing drawer, my Samsung is experiencing a 6.0 earthquake.So sit still, only use headphones to listen to loud things, and don't try to read too much, and you'll love it.  The colors/contrast on this display really are its saving grace.  The blacks--the weak point of most displays--are surprisingly rich, and a little play with the image settings will yield some fantastic colors across the range.  The software on this display is some of the best I have seen at any price, much less on a TV under $300.  Both from a features perspective and a UI perspective.

Reviews.Title: Not Bad but Not Perfection
Reviews.Author: U, Fox
Reviews.Content: I took my time to pick a small television for my kitchen. This televison has a digital tuner built in. The picture is excellent but it took about a week of adjustments to get it right. The speakers are horrible and I have tried every way of adjusting them to make them work for me. I did not want to clutter my counter with added speakers but I am seriously considering the option. The televison is a bit flimsy and would be best wall mounted. I called customer service to explain a couple of adjustments and they were excellent. There are not many small 1080p tv's available. I have seen them all and the picture quality of this Samsung is definitley, in my opinion, the best.

Reviews.Title: Slim & light.
Reviews.Author: Geno
Reviews.Content: I was using a 19" Samsung and since I could justify a 22" screen size increase unit I took a chance on the overall quality of the up graded 22" and was not disapointed at all. It has a 22" screen size which doesn't seem like much of a jump in size but put one side by another and you will see what I am talking about. I am smart enough to understand that 1080 for a screen of this size might not be an overall ageat advantage but the LED really made this unit stand out far ahead from the 19" (Which I will be trying to sell.)

Reviews.Title: Unstable base
Reviews.Author: Dixy
Reviews.Content: This Samsung 22-inch TV needs a fairly easy assembly of the TV and its base.  My husband and I did it, but the connection between the base and the body of the TV was unstable and spindly.It had to be returned by UPS.

Reviews.Title: ok for low expectations, not for everyone
Reviews.Author: griffen
Reviews.Content: While I really enjoy the great picture provided by this TV, it is only great if you're viewing from a very narrow angle off center.  My other LCD TV's provide excellent degree of viewing angle, easily over 45deg off center... this TV's viewing angle is poor at best, making it "unwatchable" at as little as 20deg off center.  That characteristic alone is very disappointing, and really restricts the use of this TV to a bedroom or kitchen location.  As far as the sound is concerned... and you can read about that in many reviews, the sound is much like you're hearing it via a string tied to a can.  The ability to compress the volume so commercials aren't blaring while dialog is faint is very limited... I found only one setting to be acceptable.  I guess you get what you pay for with this set, and you are somewhat limited on choices with this size.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, satisfactory sound
Reviews.Author: Skipper41
Reviews.Content: I bought this television because of Samsung's reputation and because it's design allowed us to replace a 19" screen with a 22" that took up less physical space. We are happy with the picture. Initially it took me a little while to get the color tint I liked on people's faces, but this is no longer an issue. The only thing that could be better would be the sound. I think that what I like about the small physical space it takes is also the reason the sound is just OK - the small size of the speakers. However, after a couple of weeks I am use to the way it sounds and no longer consider it an issue.

Reviews.Title: Nice Kitchen TV
Reviews.Author: OakParkBob
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for the kitchen to replace a 13 inch old school TV. I have a 46 inch Samsung that I bought last year with great picture. With the LED backlight set at 12, The TV has a great picture and uses only 25 watts of power. The sound is only fair though, I have to turn the volume about half way to get decent volume level.The only problem I had was having to use component cables in place of the HDMI cable. This was not a problem with the TV, but a problem with the U Verse cable box. The tech said they have some software issues they are working on.Overall I like the Samsung and would recommend it.I am looking for a wall mount so the TV can be viewed in the dining area. Don't forget to order a HDMI cable, the Amazon basic cable works well.

Reviews.Title: Superb TV and PC Monitor
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Beautiful picture quality both in the TV and PC modes.  Stylish design.  Simple set-up. Works great with Netflix.

Reviews.Title: Picture is great, perfect for my kitchen counter
Reviews.Author: Just a guy
Reviews.Content: This TV is perfect for my kitchen counter.  The stand assembles in minutes and I just plug it into the wall jack and away I go!  I have fios and the TV has an adequate tuner to get many channels without a cablebox.  That is fine for my needs.  The tv sits on the counter and I can sit at my island and watch the news while eating breakfast.  Perfect!  The picture is perfectly adequate and the sound is fine.  This is not a living room television.  It is a small tv for the kitchen counter.My expectations were met and I am happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: It's decent, but would not buy again
Reviews.Author: IslandStyle
Reviews.Content: As other reviews stated, HD looks sharp but non-HD programming looks terrible. While generally that is not an issue for me, watching slightly moderate motion content such as a basketball game or a stock ticker bar tends to be jagged or blurred.  Slow movement content such as a news cast looks very good.  Compared to the other two HDTVs in the house, this model certainly does not do my Fios cable any justice.  In hindsight, I may been better staying with my old 20 inch Vizio that did not display colors correctly.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: This tv is great for my bedroom. I had to give it 4 stars only becuase the sound is as bad as mentioned in the other reviews. That doesnt matter to me that much but I think the speakers on my iphone sound better :)

Reviews.Title: Samsung, the way to go.
Reviews.Author: Mark Rickey "paradoxss"
Reviews.Content: We have had this TV for several months now and I am quite pleased with it.  The colors are vivid and crisp and the brightness is perfect for our bedroom.  The sound could be a 'little' better but I would not say it is bad enough to even warrant a 4 star review.  The sound is about the only negative I have about it.  And even with that, it's a negative, not a problem.  Price here on Amazon was great as well.

Reviews.Title: Samsung HD TV
Reviews.Author: kylakeman
Reviews.Content: While the screen is only 22 inches the picture quality and HD effect are very noteable. We were very pleased with both the price and quality.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: MMenn
Reviews.Content: This TC is replacing a Samsung 19" LCD that died.  Picture quality on the new one is great.  Sound quality could be better.

Reviews.Title: Best TV!
Reviews.Author: PotteryMama
Reviews.Content: Samsung, as usual, delivers unsurpassed quality.  There was only one problem ... the screws that attach the base to the TV monitor were missing ... Could not find a replacement locally and have been waiting for a month for Samsung to send replacements.

Reviews.Title: great little TV
Reviews.Author: Rita
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a great picture quality TV and also small enough to fit in my kitchen. I am very happy new samsung. I would recommend this Tv

Reviews.Title: USB Video Streaming - No Ethernet
Reviews.Author: Kenneth E. Wilson "KenSanDiego"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my boat because of the USB video streaming capability. I can store 30 movies on a 32GB thumb drive making a DVD player unnecessary. But a 22" in this price range should have ALL the high end features like wifi or ethernet. No built in Netflix or other net based apps like the other high-end Samsung models. Picture is clear and bright and the TV itself is very attractive. Great TV at $149 but for $269 it leaves something to be desired. I'm happy with my purchase because I really needed a 22" with USB thumb drive streaming and it does this in spades.UPDATE: Just found out you can attach a card reader to the USB port and it will read your SDHC Cards. I have a bunch of 32GB SDHC cards laying around so now I'm filling those up with movies ;-)- It also has a very nice audio streaming app built in. The card reader compatibility just gave it another 1/2 star. I now rate it 4 1/2 stars.

Reviews.Title: Great until it crashed
Reviews.Author: Rick Winters
Reviews.Content: Worked great in the kitchen for about 10 weeks, then it fried. repair center was great, Samsung though have proven to be the worst to deal with. It crashed in early July and it has yet to be repaired or replaced. Samsung has made numerous offers to replace but never follow thru. This is the last piece of their junk that I will ever buy. I paid top dollar expecting quality. I'll buy the cheapest available now,can't do any worse.

Reviews.Title: best yet
Reviews.Author: karen
Reviews.Content: we have switched from sony to samsung.  every tv we get is better than the last one.  highly recommend samsung.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Tim Jones
Reviews.Content: I love this TV. I have it in my bedroom mounted on the wall. It looks great with an exelent picture.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with the purchase
Reviews.Author: IB
Reviews.Content: Have been using this TV for more than a year now and it's still going great! I have a portable indoor HDTV antenna connected to it which lets me see free-to-air channels like PBS. Have also been using this as a computer monitor with my Mac mini connected to it using a HDMI cable.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Monica Stevenson "moni"
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive when purchasing a used product especially a tv but I'm so glad i made the purchase.  I couldn't pass it up since it was a great deal.  I brought it for my apt and decided to set up a "man corner" since my apt is not big enough to create an entire "man cave". Now when my boyfriend (who loves the tv) comes over, he can play the playstation 3 and watch movies while i watch housewives and bridezillas on my other tv :). The reason why i am giving it four stars is because it took a little while for it to be shipped but it was worth the wait.

Reviews.Title: Super Samsung
Reviews.Author: jen
Reviews.Content: We love our Samsung! It has a great picture, works well and it is nice to have coffee in bed and watch the news!

Reviews.Title: Good Office TV
Reviews.Author: Anton V. Marchuk "Anton M"
Reviews.Content: I got this TV for my office - it has arrived quickly, set up was easy and the picture is excelent. The actual device is slim and modern.

Reviews.Title: Surprised
Reviews.Author: James G. Clawson
Reviews.Content: We have had great results with a 55" Samsung in our MBR, so when asked for Christmas gift ideas, I asked for a 22" Samsung for my office to replace a 25 year old but still going strong Gold Star 12" / VHS model. The Samsung UN22D5000N22D5000 LED 1080 P 60 is beautiful out of the box.  The stand attachment and cable search and identify went beautifully and fast.  I'm thinking, awesome.Then, surprise.  There's no adjustment on the stand, vertical or nothing.  My application is a bit above eye level in my office above phone and computer.  From that up 10* angle, the screen turns dark,  some features are black.  I tried propping it up in back with paperbacks, that helped viewing, but was unstable.  Further, the picture is fuzzy although it says it's HD.  Not as good as the old Gold Star!  Go figure.  Perhaps it's the refresh rate, 60 mhz.  Can't adjust that.  And finally sound.  Weak.  I read some reviews and decided to hook up some portable speakers I have --- and cranked all the way up, what would blow out the room with my computer music or videos, the TV is at a modest level.  It's okay for my 2' away application, but not good.SO, make sure you get the 120mhz refresher, be mindful of your viewing angle, and don't expect loud sound from this machine.  It's "good enough" but not great, not what I was expecting.  And now, a gift, stuck.

Reviews.Title: Audio Problem:???
Reviews.Author: Jose A. Diaz "Dee-Dee"

Reviews.Title: Great for gaming (for the most part)
Reviews.Author: mlm12
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV because I was getting a PS3 and wanted a television that supported standard HD definitions.  I had been using a Samsung T220HD monitor as my TV and it worked great with my xbox 360 since the 360 supported the monitors native resolution (1650x1080). However, the PS3 only supports standard TV definitions (480p, 720p, etc.) and I wanted to avoid playing on a non native resolution.  The TV works great on most games (Arkham City and Uncharted look great on my PS3), but I did notice that something didn't look 'right' on my 360.  The colors on the dash board seemed wrong when I got it and there were a lot of 'jaggies'.  I fixed the jaggies by turning the sharpness all the way down and after messing with the TV's setting it does look better, but the colors still don't seem right on the 360.  I would mess with the color setting, but the thing is the colors look really good when I am using my PS3 and I don't want to have two different configurations I have to keep switching between.  This issue is probably related to how the 360 outputs the signal, and doesn't seem to effect every game (Mass Effect looks great but the colors on Black Ops seem strange compared to my old TV).  The TV is good and has a lot of features (I haven't tried the media streaming off of USB yet), although the game mode is horrible and it has to be on standard display mode to have access to the advanced settings.  The color issue seems due to the 360 and not the TV, and it is something I will most likely just get used to.  There may be a way to change the setting so that both the PS3 and 360 look good, but since this is a fairly new product I haven't been able to find much online and I don't have much knowledge when it comes to TV settings.  I have watched Hulu Plus on it and as a TV the picture is great.  Despite what people have said, I think the sound is good (I am using it in my bedroom which isn't terribly large) and for the most part I use headphones for gaming (the jack is in the back which is a little annoying).  Over all it is a good TV with a lot of bang for your buck, I would recommend it.

I returned it to Best Buy in about 8 days and was treated like I was returning stolen goods. A disgusting experience.Bought model B2230HD from Costo at 2/3 the cost and it is a hands down winner.

Reviews.Title: Truly EXCELLENT TV with GREAT picture!
Reviews.Author: CQ DX
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV based on picture quality and aesthetics, and figured that would justify the extra cost, compared to other brands with similar screen size. The colors and detail are vivid and striking! Sound is just average, but this is true with many thin screen TV's. I just attached external speakers to it for sound improvement. What is truly amazing about this TV (and i'm writing this as an update for November 2012) is that it actually worked most of the time during our 4 day blackout following Hurricane Sandy!!!  I don't know how, or why, but while our power was out, the only things that actually worked were some of our energy saving flourescent lights and this TV.  My guess is that current draw is so low on this TV, it will do this during some blackouts, where there still may be smaller amounts of energy available on the power grid.
